column5: Duker, toad..
When ever there is a expulsion of gas on my boat (which seems to happen alot), an imaginary sturgeon gets blamed......"plllffft.....oops that stugeon is back"

I guess kind of slang, but the terminology and expressions some of the enthusiasts use to evaluate new rods/reels is getting to be a little over the top....last time i was at bps and overheard a "salesman"...lol sounded almost like a wine tasting  "a medium powered body with lack luster sensitivity throughout, paired with a clunky tip that feels to be 7 grains out of balance to my mag body jdm reel, an overall harsh finish with a dismal cosmetic wrapping that leaves much to be desired, plus no way I can have a red rod in a blue boat"....etc
Lets go rip some lips.
stink-bait
How about "here's a better fish",could be bigger or smaller or same size lol.
whistling trout - term for a sucker fish  Bonk and release - a joke term a poacher might use.
Make sure you have good drag.

Know a couple guys that still call 'em "Jackfish."     If it's not CC's it's lube tubes.  Isn't "pickerel" actually slang for walleye? lol.  Pegged it, drilled it, bombed it, nailed it.  Skunked or blanked,  Doink!
lube tubes, that's it  I thought walleye was slang for ontario pickerel
That was back when you kept the keg in the trunk and the tap was built into the dash.
those were the days, my friend we thought they would never end
I'm sure this has been posted before but it's too funny not to post again and I'm sure there's quality fisherslang in it too....
I didn't think carp was a slang word. I just thought it was a misspelled word!

Ok, let's start with bronzebacks, bucket mouths, snot rockets for species. Then there's fishing 'conditions" ----lockjaw, putting on the feed bag----and on and on it goes.  What are you favorites, or ones you love to hate??
greasers , green backs,  and what is it they call pickerel, oh yeah walleye  now what is it GBfisher calls small lake trout...it will come to me
hammer handles, flossing, snagging, tasting iron  For some reason can't think of others right now...
Carbuncklements, Ozzie Giacomelli's term for backlashes. RIP.
My non-fishing friends always seem to laugh when I suggest using 'jerkbaits with the stop and go technique"
Jerk baits are the guys I didn't really like when I was younger but were chick magnets so I let them hang around.
swamp donkey, shaker and doozer have been added to my fishvocab in recent years lol
I thought a swamp donkey was a moose, but also a type of fish??
Love to hate? This one - TANK!  One fishing show in particular everything they catch is a TANK. What a TANK! Wow that fish is a TANK!
WGSF, we caught at least 50 of those things yesterday
Lunker, chrome, silver bullet, and of course WGSF (worlds greatest sports fish)!
beat ya to it
pig, hog, cow
Check out the shoulders on that one. Cross his eyes when you set the hook.  waterworf
Skunked.

"Greaser", "snake", "hammer handle", "smash"  How bout "look at that thing run" .. kinda funny when you talking about water dwelling finned creatures.  "Setting the hook" sounds more like you're making hooks in a mold  "Bucktail" ... I wonder how many ppl hear that and thing we are cutting off deer tails and hanging them under a bobber? Lol  One my friends always seem to laugh at "a fish just BOILED over there by my bait"

Heh ... actually thats exactly what the original buck tails were ... I still have a few from the first deer ever harvested by my father ... he died the hair yellow and made a bunch of jigs .. there's still some of us 'old schoolers' who believe they outperform all the newfangled technology  How about 'birds nest' ... never been too fond of that one (especially when it happens to me or one of my guests) ... 'drift sock', 'cannonball', 'cheater', 'stinger', 'wooley  buggar', 'squaretail', 'tail walking', 'walking the dog', 'shooting tip', 'spoon',  'passer moi la pissiore' - pass me the bailing bucket  And one of my LEAST favourite ... 'cold front' ...
Dinks.  A term  you don't wanna hear. Slabs. A term you Do wanna hear.  "We slaughtered em" The very best beginning when your telling someone of a recent fishing trip.
Short strike !!!
How about "on fire"? A bit overused, I'd say!
They're still made of that hair you know...    not exactly slang
Bit off.Spooled.Threw the hook/bait.Head shakes.Death roll.

Great Lakes groupers - A.K.A. Sheephead  Hoovers - A.K.A. Carp  Both can be interesting to catch, but not as much fun when smallies are the target?  LOL, dinks to short to measure. I actually had a couple of friends nicknamed dink over the years, I never checked why.
" spark up that fish whistle "
My favorite: "Green trout"  coined by Garry2r's My least favorite: "I enjoyed myself". Usually said on the return from yet another skunking.
